outlet.digest: bang when object is changed via the interface

method.name: (drag)
method.digest: Load file or set background image
method.description: Dragging an llll or text file on the object will load its content, if a proper readable format is recognized. If the file is an image, it will be loaded as object background (whenever meaningful)

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description:
• Esc: reset center to (0, 0) and zoom to 100%
• Tab: autozoom
• Cmd+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Z (win): perform undo step
• Cmd+Shift+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Y (win): perform redo step
• Spacebar: toggle play

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
• mousewheel scroll: move the visible region
• Cmd+mousewheel scroll (mac) or Ctrl+mousewheel scroll (win): change zoom
• right-click or two-fingers tap: open contextual menu for basic operations

method.name: (tools)
method.description:
Tools are combination of a specific key pressed and some mouse action. Whenever you press the key, if the tool is available, the mouse cursor will switch to the tool specific one.
Available tools are:
• Keep the Z key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to change the zoom
• Keep the X key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to move the displayed center
• Keep the Q key pressed, click on an element, drag up or down to modify the color hue or saturation.

method.name: autozoom
method.description: Adapts view and zoom automatically according to the current stars' and planets' positions.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs a single sequencing step.

method.name: clear
method.description: Deletes all the swarms and the custom rules. If a first argument is given this might be the "swarms" symbol (to clear swarms only), or the "rules" symbol (to clear rules only).

method.name: clock
method.description: The word clock, followed by the name of an existing setclock objects, sets the dada.bounce object to be controlled by that setclock object rather than by Max's internal millisecond clock. The word clock by itself sets the object back to using Max's regular millisecond clock.

method.name: domain
method.description: The domain message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the X axis. The domain message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the left boundary or at the right boundary of the object box.

method.name: dump
method.description:
Outputs the current state of the object. The syntax is boids [rules CUSTOMRULE1 CUSTOMRULE2...] [swarms SWARM1 2...] . Each CUSTOMRULE element represents a custom rule and is in the form [[name rule_name] [code function_code] [defaultgain gain] [abscoord ac] [absintensity ai] [params PARAM1 PARAM2 PARAM3...], where the function_code must be a single symbol, and ai and ac are 1/0 values telling respectively if the function will return absolute coordinates or absolute intensity instead of a coordinate difference, and intensity difference (speed). These two last values both default to 0: functions return by default a vector which will be added to the current speed to modify it.
Each parameter is in the form [name type value], where type is a symbol among: "int", "float", "pt", and value is the corresponding value (or couple of x and y values, without parentheses, in the case of "pt" type).
Each SWARM element represents a swarm is in the form ((name name) (size num_boids) (coord COORD_BOID1 COORD_BOID2...) (speed SPEED_BOID1 SPEED_BOID2...) (intensity intensity_boid1 intensity_boid2...) (intensityspeed intensityspeed_boid1 intensityspeed_boid2...) (maxspeed maximum_swarm_speed) (maxintensity maximum_swarm_intensity) (color red green blue alpha) (applyrule RULE1 RULE2 RULE3...)), where each COORD_BOID and SPEED_BOID is in the form [x y], where each intensityspeed_boid is the difference between successive intensities (derivative), and where each RULE represents a rule to be applied to the swarm, and is in the form [rule_name [gain gain_value] [param_name param_value] [param_name param_value] ...],
where, in turn, each param_name is one of the parameters defined for the given rule "int", "float" or "pt", i.e. float couple (see the "rules" llll, above).
A first argument limits the elements to be dumped: the dump rules message only dumps the rules; the dump swarms message only dumps the swarms.
Item flags syntax in dada is the following one [flags flag1 flag2...], where each flag is one of the following symbols: lock, mute, solo, inactive.

method.name: exportimage
getdomain
method.description: The getdomain message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the X axis, preceded by a domain symbol.

method.name: getrange
method.description: The getrange message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the Y axis, preceded by a range symbol.

method.name: int
method.description: A non-zero integer triggers a play message, a zero integer triggers a stop message

method.name: llll
method.description: Sets the current state of the object. The syntax must follow the one described in the dump message documentation.

method.name: move
method.description: The word move followed the index of a swarm and a vector in wrapped [x y] syntax, translates the swarm by the given vector. If the index of the swarm is 0 or the all symbol, all swarms will be translated.

method.name: play
method.description: Starts the sequencing engine.

method.name: range
method.description: The range message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the Y axis The range message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the bottom boundary or at top right boundary of the object box.

method.name: read
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains loaded as current state. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: rotate
method.description: The word rotate followed the index of a swarm, and an angle (in radians), rotates the swarm. The angle can be set in degrees by appending the degrees ° symbol after the number (without any spaces) or by replacing the number with an llll in the form [amount_in_degrees deg]. If the index of the shape is 0 or the all symbol, all shapes will be rotated. If a third argument is added, in the form [x y], it sets the coordinates of the origin for the rotation. If no third argument is added, the default center of rotation is the shape barycenter (if a single swarm is being rotated) or the origin [0 0] if all swarms are being rotated. The center of rotation llll can be replaced by the barycenter symbol, to specify that rotation must happen around individuals barycenters. Alternatively you can add the "barycenter" symbol as third element in order to specify that coordinates are barycentric coordinates.

method.name: scale
method.description: The word scale followed the index of a swarm and a number, scales the given swarm of the factor specified by the number. If the index of the swarm is 0 or the all symbol, all swarms will be scaled. If, instead of a single factor, a list in the form [x_scale y_scale] is given, two different scale factors are applied for the X and Y axis. You can provide as third argument the scaling center, in [x y] form. If no center is provided, by default the barycenter is used for single swarms scaling, while the origin [0, 0] is used when all swarms are to be scaled The scaling center llll can be replaced by the barycenter symbol, to specify that scaling must happen with respect to individuals baricenters. Alternatively you can add the "barycenter" symbol as third element in order to specify that coordinates are barycentric coordinates.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops the sequencing engine.

method.name: write
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in native format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: writetxt
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in a human-readable text format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

attribute.name: continuousbang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang continuously during mousedrag actions.

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to embed the state of the object within the patcher.

attribute.name: fixedruleparamscolor
attribute.digest: Use Fixed Color for Rule Parameter
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to use a fixed color, instead of swarm colors, to display rule parameters. Such color is defined via the ruleparamscolor attribute.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Use Fixed Color for Rule Parameter

attribute.name: jitmatrix
attribute.description: Sets the name of a jitter matrix to which the output should be mirrored.

attribute.name: maxundosteps
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of undo steps (0 being: no undo).

attribute.name: messagebang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: notify
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send notifications for interface activities (such as clicks, mousehovers, etc.). Notifications are sent through the dedicated outlet. If the "Verbose" mode is set, whenever meaningful, the state of the notified element will be also output.

attribute.name: notifypaint
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to notify every new redraw of the box via a "painted" symbol.

attribute.name: playcolor
attribute.description: Sets the playing color.

attribute.name: playstep
attribute.description: Sets the play step interval in milliseconds.

attribute.name: ruleparamscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color used to display rule parameters, but only if fixedruleparamscolor is active; otherwise this color is overridden by the defined swarm colors.

attribute.name: seq
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to output the parameters of all boids and swarms while sequencing, in the form swarm_name boid_id x y intensity.

attribute.name: showintensity
attribute.description:
Toggles the ability to display the boid intensity in one of the following ways:
None: no intensity display.
Colorscale: fade swarm color to white.
Colorspectrum: use full color spectrum (red to violet).
Alpha: use transparency.

attribute.name: shownames
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the swarm names.

attribute.name: showruleparamnames
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the names of the displayable rule parameters.

attribute.name: showruleparams
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the rule parameters (if displayable).

attribute.name: showspeed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the boids speed vector.

attribute.name: snaptogrid
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to snap items to the grid.

attribute.name: undobang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: undobeforeplay
attribute.digest: Save State For Undo Before Playing
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to save the state for an undo step before playing

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Save State For Undo Before Playing

attribute.name: verboseundo
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to post undo/redo steps in the Max window.

attribute.name: vzoom
attribute.description: Sets the object vertical zoom percentage

attribute.name: zoom
attribute.description: Sets the object zoom percentage (or horizontal zoom, if the object is separately zoommable on horizontal and on vertical axis).

entry.name: Outlet 4 (bang)
entry.description: bang when object is changed via the interface.
